resources.string: "Gallery"
When the gallery button is pressed. It will allow you to select an image stored within your device.
Camera
When the camera button is pressed. It will shows you the camera view from which you can take a picture.
Internet

To get an image from the internet. 
Step 1 copy the URL (i.e. www.google.com) of the image. 
Step 2 past it into the search box. 
Step 3 press the search button. 
If it does not work double check that the URL is correct, and that the device is connected to the internet.
Sample
You should see a row of images. Swipe through to find an image that you like and press it.
History
You should see a row of images. Swipe through to find an image that you like and press it. All these images are images that you have traced in your past.
Reset
When the reset button is pressed. It will undo all changes made to the image.
Resize

When the resize, switch is pressed. It will enable or disable the gestures for rotation, resizing and movement. If the switch is on these gestures are enabled. If the switch is off the image is locked in place.
Flip

When one of the flip options is pressed the image is flipped on that axis. 
The x axis option will make everything on the left swap with everything on the right. 
The y axis option will make everything on the top swap with everything on the bottom. 
The both option applies both the x axis and the y axis to the image. 
This is useful when positioning the image.
Edge detection

Edge detection will find edges of objects in the image. 
The Low option will find only the most prominent edges. 
The High option will most of the edges in the image. 
This is useful for focusing on the edges when drawing.
Split image
Split image will cut out objects from the background. Hiding the background and leaving the objects. This is useful for focusing on the objects within an image.
Invert
When the invert colour button is pressed. It will switch the colours in the image to their opposite. For example, white becomes black. This would help make it easier to identify different colours.
Colour

When one of the colour bars is moved. Some of the colours will be removed. For example, if all bars are at 0 then all colours apart from black will be removed. This would help by allowing you to draw the image one colour at a time.
Colour merge
Colour merge will blend the colours of the image together. This simplifies the image into its most prominent colours.
Blur
Blur this will blur the image. This is useful to hide complex parts of the image and highlight prominent parts of the image.
Colour Overlay
Colour overlay will colour the entire image in the selected option. If two colours are hard to tell apart from each other having an overlay might help.
Transparency

When the transparency bar is moved. The image will fade into the background. If the bar is at 100 then the image will be completely visible, at 0 then the image will be invisible. This would help when tracing with the camera as you will be able to see what you are drawing through the image.
Contrast
When the contrast bar is moved. This will make the colours on image more distinguishable. When the brightness bar is moved. This will increase or decrease the brightness of the image.
Shadows
When the shadows bar is moved. This will highlight the darkness parts of the image. This would allow you focus on the shadows in the image.
Monochrome
When the monochrome button is pressed. All colour from the image is removed and replace with either black or white. This would help to make the image easier to view.
Black and white
Black and white will replace all colours in the selected image with either black or white. This is useful for focusing on the shapes that make up the image instead of the colours in the image.
